document.masterDocTitle: A Rosetta Stone for eastern Pacific Caecidae (Gastropoda: Caenogastropoda)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A Rosetta Stone for eastern Pacific Caecidae (Gastropoda: Caenogastropoda)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Caecum ( Micranellum ) limnetes Long, 1972: 291
, figs. 1–2, holotype CAS 088040 and 6 paratypes CAS 088041 , AMNH 162063 , SDMNH 55551 , FMNH 172334 , NHMUK 197012 , LACM 1446 , Estuaries of Bahia de Adair , Sonora , Mexico .

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Fartulum limnetes
—
Hertz et al. 1994: 93
, figs. 7a–c.

subSubSection.paragraph: Original diagnosis. “Teleoconch white, semitransparent, arcuation and diameter increasing only slightly toward the anterior. Annuli variable, consisting of about 40 or more raised, closely appressed rings, separated by fine incised grooves. Septum approximately hemispherical but with a right dorsal irregularity or protuberance rising in a straight line, apically, ending at the level of maximum elevation of mamillate portion of septum. Aperture never constricted. Operculum circular, horny, slightly concave, sinistral; composed of 6 to 8 rings plus a nucleus about 1/3 the total diameter of the operculum. In younger animals, diameter as well as degree of distinction between annuli increases with growth somewhat more than in older animals. Body of animal white, semitransparent, with concentrations of black pigment granules on head, beginning just dorsal to eyes and extending dorsally to edge of mantle. Mantle margin and dorsal surface of foot, beneath operculum, also with black pigment granules. Bolsters of radula black, visible through body surface. Both cephalic tentacles blunt, each with about 5 long stiff sensory cilia on tips. Tentacles with ciliated tracts along length. On right tentacle, dorsal tracts beats in a proximal direction while ventral tract beats in a distal direction. On left tentacle, the directions of beat for the tracts are reversed. Left tentacle sometimes with an undulated left lateral margin along proximal 1/2 of length.” Long (1972: 291).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 90.
Caecum limnetes
. A . Profile view with periostracum (LACM 1968-14.31). B . Profile view of smooth form without periostracum (LACM 1968-14.31). C . Profile view of ribbed form without periostracum (LACM 1968-14.31). D . Ventral view (SBMNH 114904). E . Operculum, exterior surface (SBMNH 114904). F . Operculum, interior surface (SBMNH 114904). G . Paratype, LACM 1446.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Distribution and Habitat. Restricted to the northern Gulf of California, from Cholla Bay to Guaymas, Mexico . Intertidal to
27 m .
Common in estuaries on sand and mud substrates.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 91.
Caecum limnetes
shells at different growth stages. A . Protoconch and teleoconchs I to IV (LACM 1973-5.51). B . Surface of teleoconchs I to II (LACM 1973-5.51). C . Surface of teleoconch III (LACM 1973-5.51). D . Teleoconchs IV to V (LACM 1973-5.51). E . Surface of teleoconch IV (LACM 1973-5.51). F . Surface of teleoconchs V to VI (SBMNH 114904). G . Teleoconch V (LACM 1968-14.31). H . Teleoconchs V to VI (SBMNH 114904). I . Teleoconch VI (SBMNH 114904).

subSubSection.paragraph: Remarks. The paratype at NHMLAC is a partial adult specimen (LACM 1446, Fig. 90G ). Although the holotype (CAS 088040) was available for examination it was not figured, because it is broken into five pieces.
